annotation.TEXT: Whoa, a Spiny Cheep-Cheep, which appears in 7-4 of SMB3. They must be the graphical replacement for the faster red fishies here.
Ooh, bombs! Let's try one out!
Whew! At least I stomped that last one successfully!
Cool, so now I have sword beams! Alright, let's quickly finish the level!
Hmm... I wonder why they didn't go with the Zelda II sprite for Link in this game (or at least have that as an alt. skin)...
Nuts. While I can get shell-kicking combos, I couldn't move fast enough to kill every enemy that way.
Alright, now as usual, the upper-left skin gets first dibs.
So, it looks like all you guys will need to vote for is whether I should use Simon or Ryu for 2-4 next time! To be continued...
There's the dash jump. I'll probably only use it in places where it's required.
I really want to be careful not to kick these guys' shells, because I could easily be clobbered on a rebound.

In addition, there were votes for: More awkward text colors (like the annotations I used in 1-4 last time), Mario to be used in 8-4 (hopefully I'll remember this), a Happy Halloween, every green character (counts as Luigi and Link, I think), and Soul Eater (Is that meant to be an alt. skin vote?).
KA-BOOOOM!!! I have no idea if the explosion can hurt me, and I really don't want to test this.
Nuts. Link can't get stomping combos, even though his downthrust lets me bounce from one enemy to another just like Mario can.
Oh, Quick Man has different functions.
Actually, instead of doing a tie-breaker, here's what I'll do: Bass got more 2-2 votes than Luigi did, so I'll use Bass for 2-2, and then use Luigi for 2-3!

Okay, now looking back, this level started with only 300 seconds on the clock. That's a major inaccuracy, because world 2-1 in the original SMB starts with the timer at 400. (I even double-checked this after I finished recording this video.)

Okay, I know Luigi's controls are kind of loose, but they feel more loose than expected for me... Also, yeah. I'm missing some coins, but I really don't want to worry about them right now. (Hopefully this won't mean that 3-1's 1-up mushroom will vanish...)
Huh, a bow, eh?
Oh, yeah, and he gets a boomerang to use from the get go too. That's cool.
Alright, so Link came in first, and the votes favored using him in 2-1, so now let's look at his available skins.
Nuts. I was a second too late for six fireworks... But, at least I finished the level in time!
That was close. I'm going to assume everyone starts off as a one-hit-point wonder until they've gotten a power up (except for Bill, who's always a 1HP wonder).
Can't break blocks with the boomerang, but I can with my sword!
Now, the game doesn't mention this, but Bass can rapidly shoot in various directions when you hold the fire button. However, he cannot walk while shooting.
Hello, and welcome back to Super Mario Bros. Crossover! If you'll look up above, you'll see the votes that each character has gotten...
Yes, I skipped a power up there, but I really don't have much time to waste right now!
Seems simple enough. Let's try it out on something.
Oh, and the alt. skin votes I got this time were for Dr. Wily (a Bass skin), Quick Man (another Bass skin), Luigi from SMAS+SMW, Shadow from FF6 (a Ryu skin), and Link from Link's Awakening.
Here's Bass's skins, with Dr. Wily and Quick Man among them. (I did count all alt. skin votes as votes towards the characters that they're alt. skins of.)
Aw, only 800? I think I should've been able to get at least 2000 from the ground with my double jump...
Yeah, don't worry too much about the coins. Just concentrate on survival!
Okey-dokey, here we go!
Alright, now it's Luigi's turn. Let's take a look at his skins...
Yeah! 5000 points plus 6 fireworks!
Those fireworks were just puffs of smoke...
I have no idea what Arkista's Ring is, and what is BS The Legend of Zelda? (BS stands for Broadcast Satellaview, and this was a Japan-only thing for the SNES.)
Hmm... About how high can I jump?
And here's Link's explanation. He gets upthrust and downthrust by default, which is neat.
Hmm... No platform to help me out here, but that's because Bass can dash jump and double jump. Let's try out the dash jump here.
Yay, a 1♥P! (It's a heart, so I have an excuse to type "1♥P" there!)

However, I think I want to use Mario for 3-1, for a specific reason. And, depending on what happens when I use him for that reason, I may want to use him for 3-2 as well. If that happens, the last character may end up waiting until 3-3 to be used.
I can move while shooting if I'm jumping, which is probably really handy in this level.
Okay, I think I'll have enough time for this power up right here.
Oh, man. How would I get those coins? Maybe with a double jump! (I wonder if some other characters would be given a platform to help them out...)
The mushroom gives me the blue ring (shown under my score on the status bar), and turns my tunic blue.
Ha, I can jump out of the water, which Mario can't do in the original SMB.
And, like usual, I'll go with the upper-left skin first.
More coins that require a double jump to get. I could just jump out of the water here instead, but I want the money!
Argh! That's the first hit I've taken in this game. Hopefully I won't meet my first death here...
The star still looks like a star, and... What, I'm low on time already?! Man, I gotta book it here! Looks like I'm going to have to skip some stuff, like the sky bonus area.
Alright, so next time, I'll be playing 2-4, 3-1, and possibly 3-2. I have yet to use Mario, Simon, and Ryu, so it looks like those guys will be up next.
Ha! That used to be a piranha plant, until it took an arrow to the... Wait, do piranha plants even have knees?
Whoa, that spiny fish surprised me there!
Yeah, the lower coins are probably possible to get, but I'd have very little room for error, so I'm going to skip those three.
Luigi's explanation. The usual stuff for a Mario brother.
Apparently, Peach is included with the Luigi skins, but the game doesn't have any special notes for her, so does that mean she doesn't get her signature floating ability?
Ah, but his special traits are indeed present here.
Man, these Bloopers take a lot of hits. Or, maybe Bass's gun has weaker shots to compensate for his rapid-fire.
Oh, yeah. I've been told that only Mario, Luigi, and Sophia III will swim normally in the water levels, while everyone else will get "high jump boots".
Here's Bass's explanation. He can dash and double jump, and can apparently acquire more weapons, but I doubt I'll be getting any of those in this level.
Alright, now Luigi and Bass tied for second and their votes both favored 2-2... Umm...
Alright, I'm outta here. Those last two fishies can live.
And, I accidentally went clean over the flagpole. Well, that's no help.
Uh, oh. It's the flying cheepo Trouters!
